lines.text:
[offering a drink]
Would you care for something to warm you up?
I was on the wagon, but I'll think I'll step off and give my seat to a gentleman.
I'm engaged!
Engaged? What, again!
Well, I'm not engaged exactly. You see, I'm more than engaged really.
How can you be more than engaged?
I'm married!
Oh, well... Make up your mind!
Now, you'll have to get some clothes and a toothbrush.
Ah, no, no! Not Michael Shayne and Company! His office is in his hat, and
[motioning to a suitcase in the back seat]
his home is in his car.

[Referring to Wolff and his money]
Beneath all those millions beats a heart of ice... dry ice!

[referring to Wolff]
He's a pretty tough old cookie!
Oh, don't be so hard on him. He's really very sweet.
Oh, yeah? Well, so's arsenic! I understand it tastes just like sugar!

[amazed at the size of the bathroom]
DeMille have something to do with this?
Say, what do you use for brains - feathers?

[after being caught eavesdropping at the door]
I'm Dunning, Mr. Wolff's secretary. If I can be of any service, please let me know.
I'll send up a flare.

[after Dunning leaves]
Who's that - Dumbo?
Oh, no, Dunning. Well, he's been with Dad 25 years. I wouldn't worry about him.

[dryly]
Oh, I'm not worried. He was just wandering by and got his ear caught in the door.
Well, Dad hates the idea that some day he's going to die - simply can't stand it!

[laconically]
Somebody must have told him the good die young.

[talking to a lab skeleton]
Have a cigarette, Mr. Bones?

[speaking in the skeleton's voice while moving the jaw]
Don't care if I do.
I saw your lips move.

[Recovering from a jolt of electricity]
Is my face changed?
You do look sort of funny.
Well, there's no change then.
First case I ever covered where they had the butler show you the body.
Follow me.

[awed by the size of the house]
If I owned this, I'd subdivide it.
What a beautiful funeral parlor this would make!
Make a better courthouse.

[referring to Peggy, the cook, a former girlfriend]
She's been sore at me ever since I took her to that Halloween dances last year.
Yeah?
Yeah, she forgot her mask. All I said was "You don't need one." Women's funny ctitters!

[laconically]
You know I can't understand why she should be sore.
